com.facebook.buck.query

Interface QueryEnvironment<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BuckQueryEnvironment

    public interface QueryEnvironment<T>
    The environment of a Buck query that can evaluate queries to produce a result. The query language is documented at docs/command/query.soy

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  QueryEnvironment.Argument
      Value of an argument of a user-defined query function.
      static class  QueryEnvironment.ArgumentType
      Type of an argument of a user-defined query function.
      static interface  QueryEnvironment.QueryFunction
      A user-defined query function.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.List<QueryEnvironment.QueryFunction> DEFAULT_QUERY_FUNCTIONS
      List of the default query functions.

      • getTransitiveClosure

        java.util.Set<T> getTransitiveClosure(java.util.Set<T> targets)
                                      throws QueryException,
                                             java.lang.InterruptedException
        Returns the forward transitive closure of all of the targets in "targets". Callers must ensure that buildTransitiveClosure(java.util.Set<T>, int, java.util.concurrent.Executor) has been called for the relevant subgraph.
        Throws:
        QueryException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • buildTransitiveClosure

        void buildTransitiveClosure(java.util.Set<T> targetNodes,
                          int maxDepth,
                          java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                   QueryException
        Construct the dependency graph for a depth-bounded forward transitive closure of all nodes in "targetNodes". The identity of the calling expression is required to produce error messages.

        If a larger transitive closure was already built, returns it to improve incrementality, since all depth-constrained methods filter it after it is built anyway.

        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        QueryException
